comment_text: I had this done when I was 14 and it sucks.

In Finland we don't remove the ingrown toe nail. Instead a v-shaped thin metal rail is moved under the ingrown nail. This leads the nail to grow out from the skin. After that the treatment is never to cut the nail so short that it can grow in again. My father had that operation done to him during the war in Lapland. To me it was done way more simply. Just foil paper from cigaret box wasc folded so that it was foil side out. then that was forced under the nail. Worked fine and I never since cut my toe nails so short that they can grow inside.

They've correlated high probabilty to be violent to low pain treshold and vice verse. I'm one of the mellowest guys and I've had to teach each and every doctor I've had that when I say that something hurts it means that the other guy would have jumpped to the ceiling.
I also had 2 ingrown toenail and ive'd been suffering with it for 2 years
I have to do this myself every 2-3 months

PEOPLE, I HAD MY INGROWN TOENAIL SURGERY TODAY! NOTHING, JUST TRUST ME, NOTHING HURTS! I WAS SO AFRAID, BUT TRUST ME, WHEN THE DOCTOR GIVES YOU THE ANESTHETIC YOU DON'T FEEL A THING!
